intro: Angraecum maheense, commonly known as the Mahé angraecum, is a rare orchid native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its long, slender stems and clusters of fragrant, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments within forest understories. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by moths, which are attracted to the nectar-rich blossoms. Angraecum maheense is valued for its unique appearance and is often cultivated by orchid enthusiasts.
